revised_title: Chaos in Microtine Population Dynamics: A Latitudinal Analysis
tldr: The author analyzes vole population data from various European locations and finds a latitudinal shift from stability to chaos in the dynamics of microtine populations. The study uses nonlinear time-series analysis to examine the effects of density-dependent and density-independent processes on population fluctuations. The results suggest that chaotic dynamics are more prevalent in northern populations, while southern populations exhibit more stable dynamics.
